_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
2/15/26 12:00 PM:  Its been a solid day up here, with a few fresh inches overnight that worked magic across the hill. That little refresh has gone a long way too, softening things up and bringing back that mid winter feel on groomers while adding just enough spice to keep off-piste laps skiable and most importantly-fun.

If youve been waiting for a sign to get out here, this is it! Surfaces are skiing better than they were yesterday, and the extra snow has helped smooth things out across plenty of zones. Get up here, take advantage of the refresh, and go stack some afternoon turns.

Discovery Park and Arwines Jump Line are open today.

Gentle reminder: The Mt. Rainier Gondola is available for downloading! With variable conditions on Lucky Shot, dont force the last run if you're second guessing the terrain. Take the scenic ride down and keep it smooth out there.


Notes for today:
  1. The Summit House will be closed all day on February 19th.
  2. Night Skiing hours have been adjusted to 4pm to 7pm. Night Skiing has been cancelled for the following dates: 2/16, 2/17, and 2/18. 
  3. Weve made the decision to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  4. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  5. $62 Day tickets continue every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  6. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  7. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Offered on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift quicker and more laps faster. 
  8. Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations.
  9. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 2/15/2026 3:50pm 

Forecaster: Mike Haft 
 
Synopsis:  
Atmospheric instability will continue to support snow showers through the duration of the forecast period.  A vague arctic airmass slowly lixiviates into the region. This set up hopefully contributes to daily snow showers that over deliver with righteous liquid to snow ratios.  Expect broken skies with intermittent sun breaks, afternoon convective showers, and mellifluent ridgetop winds.       
 
Sunday Night:   
Sky Cover: Cloudy with light snow showers 
Freezing Elevation: 2500 
12hr Precip: Trace 2" possible 
Wind Trends: Light 
Monday:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy with light snow showers 
Freezing Elevation: 3000 
12hr Precip: Trace 3" possible 
Wind Trends: Light 
Monday Night:   
Sky Cover: Mostly clear 
Freezing Elevation: 2500 
12hr Precip: Trace 2" possible 
Wind Trends: Light 
 
Outlook:  
Snow levels continue to drop towards sea level mid-week.  Snow showers remain in the forecast with a bit of a rinse and repeat pattern.  Certainly, dont expect much in the way of daily accumulation.   
 
Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Gold Hills and Northway will remain closed due to snow conditions.

Uphill Travel Status: PERMITTED. Uphill Travel is only permitted up the standard route up the Meadow and Quicksilver. Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.
